item.title: Using Markdown for Static Pages in Rails
item.description: Markdown is great for formatting our writing to be publish as HTML. If you’re a developer, you probably used Markdown before. Most of the time, we have to write it in HTML, which can be unpleasant.

item.title: Ruby .() notation
item.description: In Ruby, .() is a syntatic sugar for call method. class Person def call "Hello World" end end Person.new.() #=> Hello World In this example, we declare a Person class and call method in the class. With this, we can later execute Person.new.() to call the call method. Note that, we need to initialize the Person object first by calling new, since the call is a instance method.
